title: Beef Short Rib Ragu
subtitle: Rich and velvety ragu made with boneless short ribs
description: A rich, umami-packed ragu that tastes like it simmered all day but is done in under 3 hours.
author: Steve Dunn
yield: Serves 4 to 6 (Makes 5 cups, enough for 1 lb pasta)

ingredients.name: Whole peeled tomatoes, drained and chopped

instructions: Adjust oven rack to middle position and heat oven to 350°F. Microwave 1/2 cup broth and mushrooms in covered bowl until steaming, about 1 minute. Let sit until softened, about 5 minutes. Drain mushrooms, reserving liquid, and chop mushrooms fine.
Heat oil in Dutch oven over medium heat until shimmering. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

Add tomato paste, anchovies, and five-spice powder and cook until mixture has darkened and fond forms, 3 to 4 minutes. Add wine and bring to simmer, scraping browned bits. Reduce wine until pot is almost dry, 2 to 4 minutes.
Add tomatoes and reserved juice, remaining broth, mushroom soaking liquid, and chopped mushrooms. Bring to simmer.
Toss beef with salt and pepper. Add to pot, cover, and transfer to oven. Cook for 1 hour.
Uncover and cook until beef is tender, 1 to 1¼ hours longer.
Remove beef and shred. Skim excess fat from sauce. Return beef to sauce and season to taste.
notes: This recipe can be doubled and the sauce frozen for later use.
